desc:
<gh-intro><text>
We're looking for an experienced Staff Data Scientist to join our Investment Modelling team. The role focuses on building quantitative growth models and optimising investments across hundreds of cities worldwide!</text></gh-intro>
¬†
<gh-about-us><title>About us</title>
<text>
Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 50+ countries. We're a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission ‚Äì to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!
</text>
</gh-about-us>
<gh-role-detail>
<title>About the role</title>
<text>
As a Staff Data Scientist, you'll develop forecasting models to predict the short- and long-term impact of incentives on business growth. You'll also use optimization techniques to distribute incentives over different periods, cities, and channels to maximise business growth.
You'll be responsible for building products powered by Data Science models that internal teams can use for portfolio planning and budgeting. In addition, you'll work on decomposing and modelling business growth into interpretable and actionable components.
As a Staff level Data Scientist, you will coach less experienced team members by sharing good practices in problem-solving, modelling, software engineering and soft skills.¬†
</text></gh-role-detail>
¬†<gh-responsibilities>
<title>Main Tasks and Responsibilities:</title>
<bulletpoints>

<point>Utilising advanced forecasting methods to design, develop, and maintain model frameworks across multiple business verticals for short- and long-term horizons, ensuring high accuracy and low operational cost.</point>
<point>Rapidly deploying models to production with AWS and internal ML platforms and working with Python, Spark, Presto, Docker, SageMaker, Airflow tech stack.</point>

title: Software Engineer - Infrastructure / DevOps
desc:
In today's digital age, instant information is the norm. But this transparency disappears when it comes to consumer products, and their ethical and sustainable production through supply chains. Addressing the global climate challenge and safeguarding both humanity and the planet requires a transformation in food systems.  
This is why we built OpenSC.  
Co-founded by WWF and The Boston Consulting Group, OpenSC is on a mission to revolutionize the way we buy and produce products by providing data on transparency and traceability for supply chains.  
We deliver social and environmental impact by providing supply chain transparency that empowers brands to know, influence, and prove (to third parties) the sustainability of their supply chain practices.  
This is achieved through the OpenSC platform, which leverages AI, Blockchain and Remote Sensing technologies to enable automated ingestion, analysis, and sharing of a supply chain's data.
Tasks

Drive innovative solutions that empower internal teams by providing tools, support and automations, working closely with other developers and product managers.
Collaborate on designing, developing, and scaling the OpenSC platform, driving its global rollout across diverse supply chains.
Lead initiatives to strengthen security across the entire development environment.
Focus on automating infrastructure to accelerate product development and delivery.
Promote agile and software best practices and develop effective solutions to real-world challenges in collaboration with the platform team.

Our tech stack:  

We are cloud-native company and leverage AWS cloud and its services (e.g. EKS, EC2, RDS, SQS/SNS, Lambda, S3, etc.).
Our APIs are historically built with Spring Boot (Kotlin), but we are looking to become Python-first in our tech stack.
Our data pipelines are orchestrated by Dagster (Python) with data stored in S3 and Postgres, and transformations written using dbt.
We build frontend applications in Plotly Dash (Python) and web apps in React.js.
We deploy our code using CircleCI and Github Actions and use terraform for infrastructure deployment.
Our blockchain component is developed with Node.js and integrates third-party services such as IPFS and Ethereum.

Requirements

Passion and desire to work on sustainability topics and ethical production within supply chains.
Ability to excel in fast-paced, dynamic environments, contributing to designing and evolving the platform in collaboration with other engineers and product managers.
Expertise in backend software architecture and distributed systems design principles.
Expertise in cloud technologies (e.g. AWS, GCP/Azure), including proficiency with cloud services such as storage, compute, networking, monitoring, and more.
Experience in infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation.
Experience in applying security best practices and frameworks, with a focus on safeguarding systems, data, and infrastructure through robust security measures.
Excellent knowledge of software engineering best practices (e.g. test-driven development, code reviews, design documentation, etc.)
Experience with Spring Boot/Kotlin, Node.js, React.js, and data pipelines is advantageous.

title: Senior CRM Manager
desc:
Atolls is the world's largest community-driven shopping platform, active in over 20 markets worldwide.
After rebranding from Global Savings Group to Atolls, we've grown from a coupon provider into a¬†global powerhouse, empowering consumers at every step of their shopping journeys. As a trusted destination, we help millions make smarter, more rewarding spending decisions through savings, cashback, deals, product inspiration, and reviews. Our mission is to support consumers from¬†Anywhere to Purchase (A to P), making shopping simpler, smarter, and more enjoyable.
Our team of over 1,000 colleagues, representing 70 nationalities across 10 countries, works together to build¬†digital products that transform the shopping experience. We foster a culture of innovation, learning, and collaboration, giving you the¬†opportunity to grow, lead, and make meaningful contributions. Whether you're shaping products or improving user experiences, you'll be empowered to leave your mark and drive real impact.
Joining Atolls means becoming part of a global team that is constantly evolving and creating platforms relied on by millions of users for confident, seamless shopping experiences.

About This Role:
We are seeking a hands-on Senior CRM Manager to drive CRM efforts across our multiple countries and platforms. This role is ideal for a CRM expert with strong technical expertise in Braze and/or Marketing Cloud, along with HTML and SQL knowledge, who thrives in a collaborative and innovative environment. The position will focus on 80% implementation and 20% strategy, playing a key role in advancing our CRM capabilities.
Your contributions will help shape how millions of consumers interact with our platforms, guiding them to make smart, fair, and rewarding choices.
Responsibilities:
In this role, you will:

Manage Multi-Channel Campaigns: Oversee the end-to-end conception, planning, implementation, and optimization of automated/one-off¬† multi-channel campaigns throughout the customer lifecycle to maximize the engagement & revenue. Operate within an agile environment, adapting swiftly to evolving requirements.
Support CRM Platform Migration: Play a pivotal role in the migration to our new CRM platform, managing the technical and operational aspects to enable a smooth transition.
Enhance Content Personalization & Segmentation: Integrate new content sources and leverage widely available AI techniques to continuously refine segments and content recommendations, ensuring that messaging is tailored and relevant to each audience and¬† supports personalisation/relevance at scale.
Optimize and Expand the CRM Technical Stack: Maximize the effectiveness of our CRM ecosystem by fully utilizing existing systems and incorporating new data sources to enhance personalization and automation. Regularly assess potential third-party integrations that align with our strategic goals, ensuring the CRM infrastructure remains innovative, robust, and capable of supporting scalable growth and deepening customer engagement.
Drive Continuous Improvement through A/B Testing: Lead A/B testing initiatives to measure and refine CRM tactics, adopting best practices to continually improve performance.
Foster Cross-Team Collaboration: Act as a bridge between the CRM function and key cross-functional teams, particularly the MarTech & loyalty-engagement product & engineering teams. Collaborate closely to align CRM initiatives with broader business and technical strategies, ensuring seamless integration of CRM solutions with MarTech tools, data flows, and product developments.
Engage with Key Stakeholders: Work with additional teams such as Data Analytics, Design, and Local Marketing to ensure CRM strategies align with business goals and effectively serve the needs of different markets.



Your Profile:

Educational Background: Strong university degree in IT, Business Administration, Marketing, Informatics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
Experience: Minimum 4-5 years in CRM, ideally in a fast-paced startup or e-commerce environment.
Technical Skills:

Hands-on experience with marketing automation and CRM tools, specifically Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, or similar.
Expertise in scripting languages for dynamic content (AMPscript, Liquid, etc.).
Proficiency in HTML is required; SQL knowledge is a plus.

Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical skills, with the ability to identify business KPIs and optimize CRM strategies as needed.
Organizational Skills: Exceptional planning abilities, with an eye for quality and detail.
Communication: Fluency in English, both written and spoken; other languages are an asset.

At Atolls, we embrace diversity and inclusivity. Your unique background and perspectives will contribute to our shared success. If some skills are new to you but you're eager to learn, we'd still love to hear from you!
Our Benefits:
At Atolls, we believe in nurturing both your professional and personal growth. Here's what you can expect:
¬† ¬† ‚Ä¢ ¬† ¬†A culture that values personal and professional development, with internal mobility opportunities.¬† ¬† ‚Ä¢ ¬† ¬†A supportive and open-minded team that embraces diverse perspectives and innovative ideas.¬† ¬† ‚Ä¢ ¬† ¬†32 days of paid vacation plus your birthday off, giving you the time you need to recharge.¬† ¬† ‚Ä¢ ¬† ¬†A flexible hybrid working scheme to balance work and life.¬† ¬† ‚Ä¢ ¬† ¬†Access to a learning budget and internal training to help you grow in your role.¬† ¬† ‚Ä¢ ¬† ¬†Mental health coaching to support your well-being.¬† ¬† ‚Ä¢ ¬† ¬†Regular global and local get-togethers to celebrate successes and build connections.¬† ¬† ‚Ä¢ ¬† ¬†The possibility of taking a sabbatical after two years with the company.¬† ¬† ‚Ä¢ ¬† ¬†A cloud-based company setup, providing flexibility and collaboration opportunities no matter where you are.
These are global benefits that apply to all employees, with additional local perks based on your location.
Are You Up for It?
Heads up! To make our process smoother, please apply to a maximum of three roles that best match your fit. This helps us focus on finding the right opportunity for you. Thanks!¬†
We're looking forward to receiving your CV in English! If relevant, please include any supporting documents or links to relevant social media profiles.

Our employment opportunities are open to every gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, ability, place of origin, or socioeconomic status. title: Senior Product Manager
desc:
OK, so let's start with a few words about Alokai.
Alokai¬†is an award-winning and pioneering global technology startup setting a new standard in online shopping. Alokai is a Frontend as a Service solution that simplifies composable commerce. It connects all the technologies needed to build and deploy fast & scalable ecommerce frontends.Founded in 2021, Alokai (prev. Vue Storefront) is a best-in-class¬†composable commerce¬†solution and market-leading¬†Frontend as a Service currently used by 3000+ live stores around the world. With a remote, global team of 100+ people and offices in San Francisco and Warsaw, Poland, customers include Movado, SPAR Inc., or Brompton Bikes. Supported by 130+ partners and a community of 10,000+ developers, Alokai and its leaders are recipients of several industry awards, including¬†Europe's top tech startup prize¬†and recognition from¬†Forbes magazine.
Alokai is a Frontend-as-a-Service that provides several tools to help customers build performant, scalable, and customizable eCommerce storefronts. From UI libraries and integrations, to deployment and monitoring, we help businesses to build the ideal headless commerce experience.
Our products help development teams from the top enterprise companies worldwide to build outstanding frontend experiences leveraging composable architecture. We accelerate the groundwork, empower with best practices, and simplify the most complex scenarios.¬†We were the first to market this type of product in 2017, and since then, we have strengthened our market leader position through fast innovation and a deep understanding of customers' problems.¬†
We're looking for a Product Manager with a developer mindset who can help us to constantly increase the value of our products.
What's the product you'll be responsible for?
Alokai Storefront and Alokai Connect are two key products in the Alokai stack that define our platform's frontend and integration capabilities.
Alokai Storefront is a fully customizable and extensible eCommerce storefront that incorporates all the industry best practices and provides a solid foundation for building any custom experiences. The goal of this product is to accelerate the process of building eCommerce Storefronts while providing enough architectural groundwork and best practice examples to ensure that customers are set for success when they customize the application and develop their own features.
Alokai Connect's orchestration layer abstracts the complexity of connecting multiple third-party services in the frontend by providing a single API allowing to access all of them. We provide an ecosystem of ready-to-use integrations with e-commerce backends, headless CMSs, search, and payment solutions, as well as an integration framework that allows companies to easily integrate anything else.
Both products are tied together with Unified Data Layer - our own data model that abstracts the underlying API's and workflows and makes the storefront completely independent from any technology. This way customers can experiment with new technologies or migrate to new ones without reinvesting into the frontend.
As a Technical Product Manager, your goal will be to maximize the value customers get from both products by continuously improving current capabilities and researching new ones.
What will be your mission?
Put yourself in the shoes of a developer who has been tasked with the goal of bringing to life a headless commerce experience and answer the question of what tools can be delivered to them to make their lives easier:

Define Alokai Storefront & Connect Strategy: Define and communicate a compelling data-driven product vision for Alokai Storefronts & Alokai Connect, ensuring that these plans align with the company's strategic objectives and address customer needs.
Lead Strategy Execution: Your strategy is as good as your ability to execute it. Work closely with two cross-functional engineering teams, inspire them and ensure the outcome of their daily work stimulates revenue growth.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Establish tight-knit relationships with engineering and go-to-market team, creating a seamless alignment of product strategy with overarching company objectives.
User Centricity: talk to product users and prospects, understand their pain points and prioritise the problem to be solved first to make their lives easier. We deeply care about the experience of developers using Alokai's product, and we need you to care as well ;)
Risk Management: Identify potential business risks associated with product development, taking proactive measures to address and mitigate them.
No one will know better than the one who has already been there before, that's why we're looking for a product manager with previous experience as a software engineer, ideally front-end. If you are looking for a highly visible and strategic individual contributor role and want to make a big impact in a fast-growing, dynamic company, this is an excellent fit for you!


What do we expect you to have?

Experience: Minimum of 3 years in product management, with prior demonstrated experience as software engineer, ideally software engineer.

If you are an experienced software engineer or developer advocate, with a strong business understanding, eager to move to a product position as next step in your career, your profile will be interesting for us as well!

B2B/SaaS Products: A track record of managing B2B/SaaS products.
Experience with building developer tools either as a creator, manager or contributor
Experience with at least one of modern frontend frameworks like Vue.js, React, Angular etc.
Data Analysis: Demonstrated use of data to make key business decisions.
Operational Excellence:¬†Hands-on experience in product operations, including customer feedback analysis.
Communication:¬†Excellent communication skills both within a team and in customer relations. Fluency in English is mandatory.
Attitude & Approach:¬†A proactive mindset of 'How we can make this better' in problem-solving, combined with a 'Growing as a human being' approach.

Sharing our values:¬†


Vibe - you say what does not fit. You give feedback, and you listen to critical feedback as well.
Self-driven - everyone's opinion is essential, but ownership is more important. You understand that someone has to take responsibility for the decision and how it affects the whole product or company.
Focus - you stay aligned with what and how we act as a company. You move your WIGs (Wildly Important Goals) further. You take responsibility for your work and overlook the health of that area,


What can you expect?

Senior and experienced team
Budget and tools for your skills Growth
Fully Remote work with flexible working hours
Values-driven culture, friendly and supportive work environment
Contract type tailored to your need
Flat organizational structure: it helps to focus on what's essential - have no barriers in communication, no Corpo-language, no going things around, no need to do things differently than most smartly and efficiently.
Benefits: flexible working hours, working from wherever you want. Depends on the type of contract you choose.
